page.description: Other settings includes tools for testing connection strings, migrating Users and groups to the Alpha Anywhere Application Server for IIS, and configuring HTTP Publish.

item.name: Open the Users and Groups Migration Genie
item.description: Use this genie to migrate users and groups fom an Alpha Anywhere application to an Alpha Anywhere for IIS application

item.name: Open the Connection String Builder Genie
item.description: Use this genie to create a connection string that will connect from this server to the desired database.

item.name: HTTP Publish
item.description: Settings for enabling and configuring HTTP publish.

item.name: Allow HTTP Publish?
item.description: Check to enable HTTP Publishing. You must save your changes after enabling HTTP Publish before you can configure publish permissions.

item.name: HTTP Data Folder
item.description: Specify a folder where the HTTP publishing configuration is stored. Leave blank to store the HTTP publish data in the same folder as the Server Configuration XML file.

description.p: Configure the user credentials and permissions for HTTP publishing.
HTTP Publish is restricted and requires a user name and password for authorization. Use *[ui:Set HTTP Publish Permissions]* to configure credentials for users to allow publishing to the server.
A publish folder must be specified for each user profile. Selecting *[ui:<webroot>]* will allow publishing to the server webroot and any folder under the webroot.
